Class MeanTensor<T extends TNumber>

java.lang.Object
org.tensorflow.framework.metrics.BaseMetric
org.tensorflow.framework.metrics.MeanTensor<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The data type for the metric result
All Implemented Interfaces:
Metric
public class MeanTensor<T extends TNumber> extends BaseMetric
Metric that computes the element-wise (weighted) mean of the given tensors.

  • Constructor Details

    • MeanTensor

      public MeanTensor(long seed, Class<T> type)
      Creates a MeanTensor metric, using Class.getSimpleName() as the name
      Parameters:
      seed - the seed for random number generation. An initializer created with a given seed will always produce the same random tensor for a given shape and data type.
      type - the data type for the variables

    • MeanTensor

      public MeanTensor(String name, long seed, Class<T> type)
      Creates a MeanTensor metric
      Parameters:
      name - the name of this metric, if null then Class.getSimpleName() is used
      seed - the seed for random number generation. An initializer created with a given seed will always produce the same random tensor for a given shape and data type.
      type - the data type for the variables

    • updateStateList

      public List<Op> updateStateList(Ops tf, Operand<? extends TNumber> values, Operand<? extends TNumber> sampleWeights)
      Accumulates statistics for computing the element-wise mean.
      Specified by:
      updateStateList in interface Metric
      Overrides:
      updateStateList in class BaseMetric
      Parameters:
      tf - the TensorFlow Ops encapsulating a Graph environment.
      values - Per-example value. Input values must always have the same shape for all invocations of updateStateList.
      sampleWeights - Optional weighting of each example. Defaults to 1 if null.
      Returns:
      a List of Operations to update the metric state
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the shape of values in each subsequent call is not the same shape as values set during the first call

      public <U extends TNumber> Operand<U> result(Ops tf, Class<U> resultType)

      Type Parameters:
      U - the date type for the result
      Parameters:

      resultType - the data type for the result
      Returns:
      the result, possibly with control dependencies
